channel.title: Prototyping on Christopher Hamby
channel.description: Recent content in Prototyping on Christopher Hamby

item.title: Rigid Heddle Loom
item.description: Introduction In college I became interested in learning how to weave. My first loom was a model known as an Inkle Loom that my dad and I built using lumber and wooden dowels. It produced straps no wider than 4”, that were durable and well-suited for guitars, cameras, and belts. This was an excellent beginner loom that taught me many of the fundamentals of the craft. Eventually, though, I wanted to start weaving wider fabrics.
